oai_dc:dc.dc:title: James Henry Worthington Class. Coal Creek, Tenn. 1923.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The James Henry Worthington Class. Coal Creek Chapter No. 155, R.A.M., Coal Creek, Tenn. May 12, 1923. Panoramic group photograph of men, most have a pin and/or ribbon on their lapel. ID's listed on back of photograph. R.A.M. probably refers to Royal Arch Masonry, an aspect of Masons or Freemasonry.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Group portraits; Fraternal organizations; Panoramic photographs;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: To use photographs or to order reproductions, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8808. Please refer to Image Number if available and provide a brief description of the photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The James Henry Worthington Class. Coal Creek Chapter No. 155, R.A.M., Coal Creek, Tenn. May 12, 1923. Fletcher Jones, Luther Clear, Robert Beets, Curtis Pyle, Robert P. Sorrells, Harry L. Miller, Clayton H. Hall, F.H. Bratcher, W.W. Crison, B.H. Luallen, J.W.L. Cooper, Ephew Brown, H.R. Easterly, J.F. Hutson, John Godley Jr., M.C. Murphy, Evert Young, Marshal McGhee, W.G. Hatmaker, Edward W. Duncan, John L. Allen, M.C. Hatmaker, Fletcher Ross, Paul B. Stansberry, Bernard Wilson, D.W. Crouch, N.D. Wilson, James R. Miller, Harry Miller, J.D. Pebley, S.R. Tiller, Lon Pebley, J. Paris Cox, Roscoe Witt, W.H. Lear, W. D. (?) Smith, Blank Mattey, J.M. Carden, C.L. Baird, D.B. Woodard, Oba Waters, Joe M. Nelson, M.S. Scott, P.T. Roach, Fred Goins, John Harmon, C.H. Hall, E.C. Claiborne, Robt. F. Davis, C.E. Neighbert.
